maltcms.tools
Class MaltcmsTools

java.lang.Object
  maltcms.tools.MaltcmsTools

public class MaltcmsTools
extends java.lang.Object

Utility class providing many comfort methods, providing more direct access to andims compatible variables. Sort of an abstraction layer.

Author:
Nils.Hoffmann@cebitec.uni-bielefeld.de

Method Detail

binMZ

public static int binMZ(double mz,
                        double minmz,
                        double maxmz,
                        double resolution)
Calculates the normalized index of mz, by subtracting minmz and dividing by maxmz-minmz.

Parameters:
mz - mass value to bin
minmz - minimum mz of all mass values over all chromatograms, can be zero
maxmz - maximum mz of all mass values over all chromatograms
resolution - multiplication factor to scale the mass range
Returns:
an integer bin for mz, starting at 0

binMZDefault

public static int binMZDefault(double mz)
Use standard rounding.

Parameters:
mz -
Returns:

getIndexOfMaxIntensity

public static int getIndexOfMaxIntensity(Array intens,
                                         int[] maskedMassesIndices)
Returns the index of the element with highest value in array intens. Applies a filter array before, which sets all ranks to -1 if that index is masked. Then the first index with rank >=0 is searched and returned.

Parameters:
intens -
maskedMassesIndices -
Returns:

getIndexOfMaxIntensity

public static int getIndexOfMaxIntensity(Array intens)

isMaxMass

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> isMaxMass(Array masses,
                                                          Array intens,
                                                          double maxMass,
                                                          double epsilon)
Determine, whether the mass with maximum intensity within this scan is the same (within epsilon) of maxMass. Returns -1 if no mass was found within epsilon and otherwise the index of the mass within the scan.

Parameters:
masses -
intens -
maxMass -
epsilon -
Returns:

getMaxMassIntensity

public static double getMaxMassIntensity(Array intens)

Parameters:

Returns:

getPeakingMasses

public static java.util.List<Tuple2D<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double>> getPeakingMasses(IFileFragment f,
                                                                                          int apex,
                                                                                          int start,
                                                                                          int nscans,
                                                                                          double massResolution)
Returns a list of pairs, where the first element corresponds to the intensity, and the second to the associated mass channel. The elements in the list are ordered increasingly by intensity. The mass channel with the highest intensity can thus be accessed at l.get(l.size()-1). apex is from 0...nscans-1

Parameters:
f -
apex -
start -
nscans -
massResolution -
Returns:

ranksByIntensity

public static int[] ranksByIntensity(Array intensities,
                                     double intensityRangeToCover)
Expects intensities to be sorted in ascending order of masses. Returns intensities sorted ascending by intensity, so the index of the mass channel with highest intensity is at intensities.getShape()[0]-1.

Parameters:
intensities -
intensityRangeToCover - between 0 and 1
Returns:
